result.execSummary:
The defendant Taniesha A. Johnston-Knighten was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Taniesha A. Johnston-Knighten is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Taniesha A. Johnston-Knighten was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Taniesha A. Johnston-Knighten

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 10:38am
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan.
(motion to enter judgment on Ct. 1)

State notes DEOJ on count 1-- Parties in agreement for entry of judgment in that count because of new criminal charges in Portage Co -- COURT grants and finds defendant guilty.
COURT ORDERS: $100+CC; Defendant to set up payment plan in COC office.
State notes no DNA issues on this case.

Adj: 10:42am

to Revoke Deferred Entry of Judgment of Count One
-stj

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:05am
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed; DEJ agreement filed.

State moves to:
Ct. 2 (Poss THC)>>DISMISS
COURT GRANTS ABOVE

PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Poss THC)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made,  a factual basis.
COURT w/holds finding and entry of guilt - COURT adopts written deferred entry of judgment agreement as signed by all parties and submitted to COURT.

COURT defers matter for a period of 9 months for defendant to comply with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement.
If defendant is in full compliance with all terms and conditions of written DEJ agreement within that time frame and obtains no new criminal charges, State to AMEND Ct. 1 to County ordinance violation of DC with a recommended sentence of $100+CC.

DEOJ RH>> 1/26/16 at 8:30am
Bond continues.

Adj: 11:09am
Plea hearing on April 28, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 11:07am
State appears by ADA C.Minder. Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.
(set for Tent Plea)

Parties note agreement HAS been reached in this matter but defendant needs to complete assessment at Attic before plea can be completed.
COURT questions if defendant has made appointment at Attic - Atty Jackan states def lives in WI Rapids and may need to find equivalent of Attic program in Rapids
COURT directs defendant to attempt to contact Attic today and possibly start assessment as she is in Wausau today; To be reset for plea before JT date.
Bond continues.
